snippet: The plant, to be built by Sasol, a South African company, would produce 96,000 barrels of fuel a day using a “gas to liquids” technology.
abstract: South African energy company Sasol will build America's first commercial plant to convert natural gas to diesel and other liquid fuels; it plans to produce 96,000 barrels daily.
lead_paragraph: The plant, to be built by Sasol, a South African company, would produce 96,000 barrels of fuel a day using a “gas to liquids” technology.

headline.seo: Sasol Plans First Gas-to-Liquids Plant in U.S.
headline.main: South African Company to Build U.S. Plant to Convert Gas to Liquid Fuels
headline.print_headline: South African Company to Build U.S. Plant to Convert Gas to Liquid Fuels
